metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/
aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon's Regulatory Compliance in China and India
Amazon provides technology services in China through contractual relationships with third parties that hold PRC licenses.
The contractual relationships with Chinese third parties are designed to meet local ownership requirements.
The contractual relationships with Chinese third parties are designed to meet regulatory licensing requirements.
The contractual relationships with Chinese third parties are designed to meet cybersecurity requirements.
The government of India restricts foreign entities' ownership of Indian companies involved in online multi-brand retail trading activities.
The government of India restricts foreign entities' control of Indian companies involved in online multi-brand retail trading activities.
Amazon provides marketing tools to third-party sellers on www.amazon.in.
Amazon provides logistics services to third-party sellers on www.amazon.in.
Amazon's services enable third-party sellers on www.amazon.in to sell online.
Amazon's services enable third-party sellers on www.amazon.in to deliver to customers.
Amazon holds an indirect minority interest in an entity that is a third-party seller on the www.amazon.in marketplace.
Amazon believes its structures and activities comply with existing laws in China and India.
Amazon's structures and activities in China and India involve unique risks.
The People's Republic of China (PRC) may consider changes in regulatory requirements that could impact Amazon's structures and activities.
The People's Republic of China (PRC) may implement changes in regulatory requirements that could impact Amazon's structures and activities.
India may consider changes in regulatory requirements that could impact Amazon's structures and activities.
India may implement changes in regulatory requirements that could impact Amazon's structures and activities.
India may consider changes in licensing requirements that could impact Amazon's structures and activities.
India may implement changes in licensing requirements that could impact Amazon's structures and activities.
The People's Republic of China (PRC) may consider changes in licensing requirements that could impact Amazon's structures and activities.
The People's Republic of China (PRC) may implement changes in licensing requirements that could impact Amazon's structures and activities.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/
/FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/

text: For example, in order to meet local ownership, regulatory licensing, and cybersecurity requirements, we provide certain technology services in China through contractual relationships with third parties that hold PRC licenses to provide services. In India, the government restricts the ownership or control of Indian companies by foreign entities involved in online multi-brand retail trading activities. For www.amazon.in, we provide certain marketing tools and logistics services to third-party sellers to enable them to sell online and deliver to customers, and we hold an indirect minority interest in an entity that is a third-party seller on the www.amazon.in marketplace. Although we believe these structures and activities comply with existing laws, they involve unique risks, and the PRC and India may from time to time consider and implement additional changes in their regulatory, licensing, or other requirements that could impact these structures and activities.
